com.wj.android.messageviewer.message

Interface IMMSMessagePart

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GenericMessagePart, ImagePart, SMILPart, TextPart, VCardPart

    public interface IMMSMessagePart
    This Interface represents a content part of a MMS message. A MMSMessage may contain one or multiple content parts.
    Author:
    Werner Jaeger

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IMMSMessagePart.ContentType 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getCharSet()
      Get the character set of the content.
      byte[] getContent()
      Get the content data of this message part.
      java.lang.String getContentId()
      Get the content identifier of this message part.
      java.lang.String getContentLocation()
      Get the content location of this message part.
      IMMSMessagePart.ContentType getContentType()
      Get the content-type of this message part.
      java.lang.String getText()
      Get the text of the message part.

    • Method Detail

      • getContent

        byte[] getContent()
        Get the content data of this message part.
        Returns:
        a byte[] with the content data.

      • getContentLocation

        java.lang.String getContentLocation()
        Get the content location of this message part.
        Returns:
        the location of the content.

      • getContentId

        java.lang.String getContentId()
        Get the content identifier of this message part.
        Returns:
        the identifier of the content.

      • getContentType

        IMMSMessagePart.ContentType getContentType()
        Get the content-type of this message part.
        Returns:
        the content-type.

      • getText

        java.lang.String getText()
        Get the text of the message part.

        For media type parts like image the content location is returned.

        Returns:
        the text.

      • getCharSet

        java.lang.String getCharSet()
        Get the character set of the content.

        The character set is ignored for binary content.

        Returns:
        the character set. Never null
